snippet: Gen. Raheel Sharif went to Afghanistan to seek help in locating the Pakistani Taliban commanders who orchestrated the Peshawar school massacre.
abstract: Gen Raheel Sharif and Lt Gen Rizwan Akhtar, Pakistan’s army and intelligence chiefs, travel to Afghanistan to seek help locating Pakistani Taliban commanders responsible for massacre of students at school in Peshawar; some also see trip as effort to find common ground between Afghanistan and Pakistan, whose already fraught relationship may be suddenly at risk of worsening.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Azam Ahmed from Kabul, Afghanistan. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Declan Walsh from London.

lead_paragraph: Gen. Raheel Sharif went to Afghanistan to seek help in locating the Pakistani Taliban commanders who orchestrated the Peshawar school massacre.

headline.main: Pakistan Urges Afghans to Help Find Taliban Leaders Behind Massacre
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Urges Afghans to Help Find Taliban Leaders Behind Massacre

keywords.value: Army Public School and Degree College (Peshawar, Pakistan)
